data.title: British musical comedy films
data.text:
1.

The Rocky Horror Picture Show

1975 American film by Jim Sharman

Overview: The Rocky Horror Picture Show is a 1975 musical comedy horror film by 20th Century Fox, produced by Lou Adler and Michael White and directed by Jim Sharman. The screenplay was written by Sharman and actor ...

Release date: 14 August 1975

Genre: Comedy, Musical, Horror, Sci-Fi

Director: Jim Sharman

A newly engaged couple have a breakdown in an isolated area and must pay a call to the bizarre residence of Dr. Frank-N-Furter.

0 0

2.

Mamma Mia!

2008 American romantic comedy musical movie directed by Phyllida Lloyd

Overview: Mamma Mia! (promoted as Mamma Mia! The Movie) is a 2008 romantic comedy film containing music directed by Phyllida Lloyd and written by Catherine Johnson based on her book of the 1999 theatre show of the ...

Release date: 30 June 2008

Genre: Comedy, Musical, Romance, Music

Director: Phyllida Lloyd

Writer: Catherine Johnson

The story of a bride-to-be trying to find her real father told using hit songs by the popular 1970s group ABBA.

0 0

3.

Hairspray

2007 film directed by Adam Shankman

Overview: Hairspray is a 2007 musical romantic comedy film based on the 2002 Broadway musical of the same name, which in turn was based on John Waters's 1988 comedy film of the same name. The film was a British ...

Release date: 13 July 2007

Genre: Comedy, Musical, Romance

Director: Adam Shankman

Pleasantly plump teenager Tracy Turnblad teaches 1962 Baltimore a thing or two about integration after landing a spot on a local TV dance show.

0 0

4.

Bugsy Malone

1976 gangster musical comedy film

Overview: Bugsy Malone is a 1976 gangster musical comedy film written and directed by Alan Parker. The film was Parker's feature film directorial debut. A co-production of United States and United Kingdom, it f ...

Release date: 1 May 1976

Genre: Comedy, Crime, Family, Musical

Director: Alan Parker

Writer: Alan Parker

The classic gangster story of Bugsy Malone told with an all-child cast.

0 0

5.

Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory

1971 film by Mel Stuart

Overview: Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory is a 1971 American musical fantasy film directed by Mel Stuart and starring Gene Wilder as Willy Wonka. It is an adaptation of the 1964 novel Charlie and the Chocolate ...

Release date: 30 June 1971

Genre: Family, Musical, Fantasy, Comedy

Director: Mel Stuart

A poor but hopeful boy seeks one of the five coveted golden tickets that will send him on a tour of Willy Wonka's mysterious chocolate factory.

0 0

6.

Spice World

1997 film by Bob Spiers

Overview: Spice World is a 1997 British musical comedy film directed by Bob Spiers and written by Kim Fuller. The film stars pop girl group the Spice Girls, who all play themselves. The filmâ€”made in a similar vein ...

Release date: 15 December 1997

Genre: Comedy, Family, Music

Director: Bob Spiers

World famous pop group the Spice Girls zip around London in their luxurious double decker tour bus having various adventures and performing for their fans ...

0 0

7.

Gnomeo & Juliet

computer-animated film loosely based on ''Romeo and Juliet''

Overview: Gnomeo & Juliet is a 2011 3D computer-animated fantasy romantic comedy film directed by Kelly Asbury. It is loosely based on the play Romeo and Juliet by William Shakespeare and an original screenplay ...

Release date: 23 January 2011

Genre: Romance, Fantasy, Family, Animation, Adventure, Comedy

Director: Kelly Asbury

Separated by a garden fence and a feud, are blue gnomes on one side and red gnomes on the other. This doesn't stop blue Gnomeo and red Juliet from falling ...

0 0

8.

Corpse Bride

2005 British-American stop-motion-animated fantasy film

Overview: Corpse Bride (also known as Tim Burton's Corpse Bride) is a 2005 stop-motion animated musical fantasy film directed by Mike Johnson and Tim Burton with a screenplay by John August, Caroline Thompson and ...

Release date: 7 September 2005

Genre: Animation, Comedy, Fantasy, Music, Romance, Musical

When a shy groom practices his wedding vows in the inadvertent presence of a deceased young woman, she rises from the grave assuming he has married her ...

0 0

10.

The Muppet Movie

1979 film directed by James Frawley

Overview: The Muppet Movie is a 1979 British/American musical road comedy film directed by James Frawley and produced by Jim Henson. A co-production between the United Kingdom and the United States, it is the first ...

Genre: Adventure, Comedy, Family, Musical

Director: James Frawley

Kermit and his newfound friends trek across America to find success in Hollywood, but a frog legs merchant is after Kermit.

0 0

11.

James and the Giant Peach

1996 animated film directed by Henry Selick

Overview: James and the Giant Peach is a 1996 musical fantasy film directed by Henry Selick, based on the 1961 novel of the same name by Roald Dahl. It was produced by Tim Burton and Denise Di Novi, and starred ...

Release date: 12 April 1996

Genre: Animation, Adventure, Family, Fantasy, Musical

Director: Henry Selick

An orphan who lives with his two cruel aunts befriends anthropomorphic bugs who live inside a giant peach, and they embark on a journey to New York City ...

0 0

13.

Mamma Mia! Here We Go Again

2018 American musical film directed by Ol Parker

Overview: Mamma Mia! Here We Go Again is a 2018 jukebox musical romantic comedy film written and directed by Ol Parker, from a story by Parker, Catherine Johnson, and Richard Curtis. It is a follow-up to the 2008 ...

Release date: 20 July 2018

Director: Ol Parker

Five years after the events of Mamma Mia! (2008), Sophie prepares for the grand reopening of the Hotel Bella Donna as she learns more about her mother's ...

0 0

15.

Yellow Submarine

1968 film by George Dunning

Overview: Yellow Submarine (also known as The Beatles: Yellow Submarine) is a 1968 British animated musical adventure film inspired by the music of the Beatles, directed by animation producer George Dunning, and ...

Release date: 17 July 1968

Genre: Music, Fantasy, Family, Comedy, Animation, Adventure, Musical

Director: George Dunning

The Beatles agree to accompany Captain Fred in his Yellow Submarine and go to Pepperland to free it from the music hating Blue Meanies.

0 0

16.

Victor/Victoria

1982 film by Blake Edwards

Overview: Victor/Victoria is a 1982 British-American musical comedy film directed by Blake Edwards and starring Julie Andrews, James Garner, Robert Preston, Lesley Ann Warren, Alex Karras, and John Rhys-Davies ...

Release date: 16 March 1982

Genre: Comedy, Music, Romance, Musical

Director: Blake Edwards

A struggling female soprano finds work playing a male female impersonator, but it complicates her personal life.

0 0

17.

The Pirates of Penzance

1983 film directed by Wilford Leach

Overview: The Pirates of Penzance is a 1983 British-American romantic musical comedy film written and directed by Wilford Leach based on Gilbert and Sullivan's 1879 comic opera of the same name. The film, starring ...

Release date: 18 February 1983

Genre: Comedy, Musical, Romance

Director: Wilford Leach

This movie is an adaptation of Gilbert and Sullivan's comic operetta of the same name, with parts of other of their operettas stirred in...

0 0

18.

The Great Muppet Caper

1981 film by Jim Henson

Overview: The Great Muppet Caper is a 1981 musical heist comedy film directed by Jim Henson (in his feature directorial debut). It is the second theatrical film in The Muppets franchise. In the plot, the Muppets ...

Release date: 26 June 1981

Genre: Comedy, Family, Music

Director: Jim Henson

Kermit, Gonzo and Fozzie are reporters who travel to Britain to interview a rich victim of jewel thieves and help her along with her secretary, Miss Piggy ...

0 0

19.

Help!

1965 British musical comedy-adventure film starring the Beatles

Overview: Help! is a 1965 British musical comedy-adventure film directed by Richard Lester, starring the Beatles and featuring Leo McKern, Eleanor Bron, Victor Spinetti, John Bluthal, Roy Kinnear and Patrick Cargill ...

Release date: 29 July 1965

Genre: Comedy, Musical, Fantasy, Mystery, Adventure

Director: Richard Lester

Producer: Walter Shenson

Sir Ringo Starr finds himself the human sacrifice target of a cult, and his fellow members of The Beatles must try to protect him from it.

0 0
